page.title: 07Newmarket Sewage Treatment
page.content: The sewage treatment plant in the Fordham Road between Newmarket and Fordham is part of the Anglian Water Authority. It handles all the sewage from Newmarket and Exning. The sewage is filtered then pumped into settlement tanks where bacteria break down the solids. The tanks are sprayed with clean water to help this process. Afterwards the sludge is given to farmers as fertiliser and the fluids are treated then pumped into the local River Snail. The plant employs two operatives and a truck driver and is supervised by a member of the authority based in Diss who has responsibility for 30 plants in the South Norfolk and Suffolk area. The plant was put here because the land was available at the right time and it provided a suitable position on the water course for drainage.
